review.title: Mathematical Knowledge Representation: Semantic Models and Formalisms
review.abstract: The paper provides a survey of semantic methods for solution of fundamental tasks in mathematical knowledge management. Ontological models and formalisms are discussed. We propose an ontology of mathematical knowledge, covering wide range of fields of mathematics. We demonstrate applications of this representation in mathematical formula search, and learning.

sections.heading: 5. Conclusion
sections.text: The paper summarizes the main tasks of mathematical knowledge representation. We provide an overview of the state of the art in semantic models of mathematical documents. We present ontology-based formalisms for knowledge representation as well as our novel ontological model OntoMathPRO for mathematics. We present applications of the proposed semantic models for the search and learning of mathematical formulas. We emphasize that ontology has reached maturity, but is the result of ongoing work. Ontology is publicly available on ontomathpro.org. On this website, we encourage our colleagues to participate in collaborative work, including correction and contributions to new classes, relationships and definitions. We also organize a discussion to consider novel applications. Acknowledgements: A.
